ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: AASPIRE Participant Type / Version Administered
Notes: 1= Direct Report (DR); 2= Direct Report - Supported (DR-S); 3= Caregiver Report (CR)

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I / Caregiver Report: I think they) usually set (my/their) own goals (with as much support as I/they want).
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I have / Caregiver Report: I think they have) what (I/they) need (e.g., supports, skills motivation, resources, and freedom) to reach (my/their) goals.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: When (Direct Report: I / Caregiver Report: they) have a problem, (I can/I think they can) usually come up with more than one way to solve it.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: When (Direct Report: I / Caregiver Report: they) make plans for (my/their) future, (I can usually think of/I think they can usually imagine) many different possibilities (different things that may or may not happen).
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I know / Caregiver Report: I think they know) what (I am/they are) good at and not so good at.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I / Caregiver Report: They) usually get to plan what to do with (my/their) free time.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I / Caregiver Report: They) usually keep trying after (I/they) get something wrong.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: In general, (Direct Report: I believe / Caregiver Report: I think they believe) that trying hard can help (me/them) reach (my/their) goals.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I / Caregiver Report: They) usually choose to do activities (I/they) want to do, with as much support as (I/they) want.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I / Caregiver Report: I think they) usually work hard to reach (my/their) goals.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: When something gets in (Direct Report: my / Caregiver Report: their) way, (I/they) can usually figure out ways to get around it.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I usually feel / Caregiver Report: I think they feel) confident in (my/their) ability to do the things that are important to (me/them), with whatever supports (I/they) want or need.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report: I think) the lessons (Direct Report: I / Caregiver Report: they) learned from (my/their) past experiences can often help (me/them) plan what (I/they) will do next.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I often think / Caregiver Report: I think they often spend time thinking) about (my/their) goals.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I / Caregiver Report: I think they) usually make choices that are important to (me/them).
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I tend / Caregiver Report: I think they tend) to look for new experiences (I/they) think (I/they) will like.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I think / Caregiver Report: I think that they believe) that (I/they) will be able to reach (my/their) goals.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I / Caregiver Report: They) can choose how to decorate (my/their) space within (my/their) home.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I / Caregiver Report: They) usually take advantage of new opportunities (possibilities or chances to do things you want to do) when they come (my/their) way.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I can / Caregiver Report: I think they can) recognize and understand (my/their) strengths. For example, patience and creativity, but being stubborn can also be a strength if it helps keep (you/them) going.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I can / Caregiver Report: I believe they can) think of one or more ways to reach (my/their) goals.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Self Determination Inventory - Overall, in the last six months, did the things this survey asked about...
Notes: 1= Get worse; 2= Stay about the same; 3= Get better

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) Did you get any help while answering the questions in this section of the survey?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): I did not get any help
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me use a computer, smartphone, or other device (for example, they clicked on the answers I chose).
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone read the survey to me.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me understand what the questions or answers options meant.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me decide how to answer the questions on the survey.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): I got some other type of help to answer the questions.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone answered the questions for me, without my input.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): They told me (in whatever mode they communicate)
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I have observed the action, behavior, or event
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I can interpret their behaviors and/or vocalizations
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Someone else told me
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I feel like I can guess because I have known them for a long time
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I feel like I can guess because I spend a lot of time with them
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Other
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): None of the above
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Other, specify
(Caregiver Report) On a scale of 0 to 10, how confident are you about your responses?
Notes: 0= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Self Determination - Sum
Notes: Higher scores indicate more feelings of autonomy in responses. Sum of (sdi_set_goals, sdi_needs_met, sdi_solutions, sdi_future, sdi_talents, sdi_freetime, sdi_trying, sdi_believe, sdi_activities, sdi_workhard, sdi_problemsolve, sdi_confidence, sdi_lessons, sdi_think_goals, sdi_choices, sdi_experiences, sdi_reach_goals, sdi_decorate, sdi_opportunities, sdi_strengths, sdi_ways_goals)

ElementDescription: Self Determination - Average
Notes: Higher scores indicate more feelings of autonomy in responses. Mean of non-missing responses from (sdi_set_goals, sdi_needs_met, sdi_solutions, sdi_future, sdi_talents, sdi_freetime, sdi_trying, sdi_believe, sdi_activities, sdi_workhard, sdi_problemsolve, sdi_confidence, sdi_lessons, sdi_think_goals, sdi_choices, sdi_experiences, sdi_reach_goals, sdi_decorate, sdi_opportunities, sdi_strengths, sdi_ways_goals)
